Name: Brussels-Capital
Description: Brussels-Capital is the capital region of Belgium and the seat of the European Union. Known for its historic buildings, cultural institutions, and cosmopolitan atmosphere.

Name: Antwerp
Description: Antwerp is a port city in the Flanders region, known for its diamond district, vibrant arts scene, and historical architecture.

Name: East Flanders
Description: East Flanders is a region located in the north of Belgium, famous for its medieval cities, such as Ghent, and its scenic countryside.

Name: Flemish Brabant
Description: Flemish Brabant is a province in the central part of Belgium, known for its historical sites, green spaces, and proximity to Brussels.

Name: Hainaut
Description: Hainaut is a province in the Wallonia region of Belgium, known for its industrial heritage, picturesque towns, and nature reserves.

Name: Liège
Description: Liège is a province in Wallonia, known for its industrial history, cultural landmarks, and the vibrant city of Liège itself.

Name: Luxembourg
Description: Luxembourg is a province in the southernmost part of Belgium, known for its rural beauty, medieval castles, and small picturesque towns.

Name: Namur
Description: Namur is a province in the Wallonia region of Belgium, known for its rich history, including the Namur citadel, and its proximity to the Ardennes.

Name: Walloon Brabant
Description: Walloon Brabant is a province in Wallonia, known for its beautiful nature reserves, charming towns, and historical monuments.

Name: West Flanders
Description: West Flanders is a coastal province in Flanders, known for its beaches, historical towns, and the city of Bruges, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
